alert.note: Alert for Alameda; Contra Costa; San Mateo; Santa Clara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 13 at 8:21AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following areas, Alameda, Contra Costa, San Mateo and Santa Clara. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 821 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in Interstate 880 and Highway 101. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Interstate 880 and Highway 101 is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Alameda; Contra Costa; San Mateo; Santa Clara
